title: Police open fire at hijacked car in Kotahena
byline: Police opened fire at a car that was fleeing after being hijacked in Kotahena last night.

title: Navy intercepts local fishing trawler smuggling over 100 kgs of Ice, heroin
byline: Six suspects were arrested with 77 kilograms and 484 grams of heroin and 42 kilograms and 334 grams of Methamphetamine (Ice) during a special operation on the high seas by the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: Thundershowers expected in parts of the country: Met Department
byline: Showers or thundershowers are expected at a few places in the Central, Sabaragamuwa, Western, Southern, and Uva Provinces, as well as in the Ampara and Batticaloa districts during the afternoon or night, the Forecasting Division of the National Meteorological Centre said.

title: Herbal bath marks farewell to the old year
byline: In a deeply symbolic tradition observed across the country, communities gathered today (April 13), to perform the customary Ritual Bath for the Old Year, marking the end of one cycle and preparing to welcome the new.

title: SriLankan cabin crew begin ’work to rule’ over meal allowance
byline: The SriLankan Airlines Cabin Crew Members Association has launched a ’work to rule’ campaign, citing several demands, including the reallocation of their onboard meal allowance.

title: Magnitude 5.6 earthquake jolts Myanmar
byline: A magnitude 5.6 earthquake struck Myanmar on Sunday, the European Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC) said, with no immediate reports of news casualties or property damage.

title: Heat index forecast warns of caution levels for 14 districts
byline: While issuing a warm weather advisory today, the Natural Hazards Early Warning Centre of the Meteorology Department said that the temperature felt by the human body is expected to rise to caution levels.

title: Conquer adversity and work for a future of shared success during the new year: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today urged all Sri Lankans to  navigate the road ahead, conquer adversity and work toward a future of shared success in the New Year.

title: Bangladesh issues arrest warrant for British MP Tulip Siddiq
byline: Bangladeshi authorities have issued an arrest warrant for the British MP and former Labour minister Tulip Siddiq.

title: Passara–Namunukula road closed after pine trees fall
byline: The Passara–Namunukula main road has been temporarily closed from tonight (13) due to a hazardous situation caused by two large pine trees that fell onto the road near the 12th mile post, Namunukula Police said.

title: Inauspicious time begins
byline: The period between the old year and the new, known as ‘Punya Kalaya’ or ‘Nonagathaya’—the inauspicious time—will be observed from 8:57 PM on April 13 to 9:45 AM on April 14.’’

title: 153-year-old tortoise selected for New Year’s oil anointing at Dehiwala Zoo
byline: The oldest resident of the Dehiwala National Zoo, a 153-year-old giant tortoise has been selected to take part in the traditional New Year’s Anointing of Oil ceremony, scheduled to be held at 9:04 a.m. on April 16, according to the zoo’s Operations Director, Anoma Priyadarshini.

title: Expressways generate over Rs. 100 million revenue on April 11, 12
byline: Over Rs. 100 million in revenue was generated from expressway tolls on April 11 and 12, according to R.A.D. Kahatapitiya, Director of the Expressway Operation, Maintenance, and Management Division.
